description: Put PNG image and it just crash.
Works for .jpg hangs for .png ; Also it's bad that it simply replaces original image and doesn't have undo option.. With these featerus implemented it would be a cool app.
summary: Good idea but not there yet.

description: Had no problems, just throw the image in, and it immediatly compressed the images. Not sure if it's lossless or not and I think it could use a button to confirm if you actually want to compress it, but it does its job.
nothing happens, it loads the image into the program but then it's just stuck

It worked fine out of the box. It was simple and intuitive. A word of caution: when it did it's thing on the files, it did not create a new file with the reduced file size, it simply altered the file size of the original. So just be advised. So, as I was saying, it worked fine at first. Then yesterday I gave it a batch of about a dozen 16MB files to optimize and it appeared to be chugging away but nothing seems to have really been happening. After a long while (maybe an hour) I used Dolphin to examine the file sizes of the subject files, and nothing had been done. I tried over and over and got the same results. Right now I am about to try a fresh install and hopefully that will fix the problem. Alternatively, I'll be looking for an alternate program to do the job.
